key_channel_insights.line_content: 80.41% of OTA offers matched Air Europa's website, demonstrating strong pricing consistency.
MSE consistently shows lower prices in 85.71% of itineraries compared to the airline's website.
82.65% of prices on GDS matched Air Europa's website, reflecting strong alignment with pricing strategies.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: The majority (80.41%) of OTA channel offers matched Air Europa's website last week, indicating stable pricing consistency.
Only 0.61% of tickets were priced lower on OTA within the last week, suggesting minimal channel-exclusive pricing advantages.
Tickets that were higher on the OTA saw a slight increase of up to 0.19% compared to the previous week.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: There was a notable increase of 9.42% for offers not available on OTAs since the previous week, indicating some exclusive fares disappearing from view.
The presence of identical prices on both the website and OTA decreased by 9.19% compared to the previous week, showing slight dilution in mirroring website prices.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: No significant variation across short-haul routes, with 80.41% of prices identical between OTA and website in last week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Across Spain POOs, 80.41% of prices remained identical on OTA as they were on the airline's website.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings showed a reduced match by 12.98% compared to the previous week, with OTA prices higher for 8.53% of these itineraries.
Far-out bookings maintained a high price match rate at 95.33%, with marginal channel differences.

mse_highlights.line_content: The MSE channel displays significantly lower prices compared to the airline's website, with 85.71% of itineraries being cheaper in MSE for the latest week.
Only 5.71% of listings were priced similarly across MSE and the airline site, indicating rare price parity.

mse_highlights.line_title: Narrow Gap for Higher Prices in MSE
mse_highlights.line_content: Just 0.20% of itineraries are higher priced on MSE, suggesting infrequent instances of overpricing.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_title: Website Offers Not Found on MSE
mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 8.37% of listings had no equivalent found on MSE, a slight decrease compared to historical data.
MSE offered lower prices in 85.71% of cases, maintaining an 8% consistency from previous months.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: The competitive pricing trend continues in short-haul markets, with an 85.71% occurrence of lower prices on MSE.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Departures from Spain align with the overall trend, as 85.71% of sampled itineraries see lower prices on MSE.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: In late booking windows, 80% of MSE listings are priced lower than the airline site, a dominant trend observed.
For far-out bookings, pricing remains relatively consistent with a high 98.67% parity or lower, reinforcing MSE's competitive edge.

gds_highlights.line_content: Across the GDS channel, prices on 82.65% of short haul routes matched those on Air Europa's website last week.
For close-in bookings, only 1.47% of prices on GDS were lower than on Air Europa's website, showing minimal price competitiveness.
Across analyzed dimensions, GDS pricing showed minor fluctuations with a consistent competitive pattern over the weeks and months under review.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: For both overall and specific dimensions analyzed, GDS had 8.57% of offers not matching the website, showing a slight improvement from previous periods.
A significant portion, 82.65%, of the fares on GDS showed parity with the website last week, reflecting strong alignment with Air Europa's pricing strategy.
7.76% of GDS prices were higher than the website, with negligible change observed over recent weeks.
Only 1.02% of prices on the GDS channel were lower than the website, changing marginally from previous weeks, indicating limited occurrences.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes predominantly showed a high level of price parity (82.65%) compared to other disparities.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Originating routes from Spain (ES) on the GDS channel reflected global trends, maintaining high price parity (82.65%) with slight variances in other statuses.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in affairs were mostly well-aligned with the website, yet showed the smallest segment of GDS lower pricing at just 1.47%.
Far-out bookings displayed the highest consistency with the website at 95.97%, underscoring GDS's price stability for advanced bookings.
